"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a52fe263687273723c0100#post_53a52fe263687273723c0100

ill probably be bad at the second, third, fourth, fifth, and six time.

i know about myself enough to know it will took me a long time to know how to doit right.

this reminds me if tylerÂ´s song "awkward" where he describes having a date with a girl and kissing her, but instead of being this magical moment, he is instantly struck by insecurities, not knowing what to do next, how can he act like a good boyfriend, how can he mantain this relationship.

and then he starts thinking "im not good at this, she will dump me for a better guy, yeah she will do that, i suck so much"

that pretty much describes me.

topics.body: So I figured out what the problem was with linux wanting to play league of legends; derp they updated again.  Basically every time wine, playonlinux or the actual game updates something breaks.  For people that have backrounds in programming it's easy to fix, but it's complete bullcrap that you have to jump through so many hoops.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5393b636872745afc0500#post_53a5393b636872745afc0500
My body is beyond reggie.



Going back to what I was talking about earlier and well since we're talking about gaming anyhow real quick I think I figured out what is probably going to be the biggest change that your average consumer will notice within five years; crossplatform everything.  What I mean by this is most computer programs and most games with a bit of elbow grease you can get to work on other hardware and operating systems and so forth; right now there's a massive push towards making everything at least on the basic level crossplatform.

This coupled with how right now there's a massive push to drive costs down will probably change a lot of things under the surface.

What I mean by this is that in say five years all your games will work on windows, mac, linux, xbox, playstation, nintendo consoles and so forth and a lot of the programs you buy will be cheaper adjusted for inflation.

Basically almost all your games will work on any device and programs like photoshop and such will be much cheaper.
